Yes, but you'd need to set cudnnSetRNNMatrixMathType, similarly to how it is done here https://github.com/SeanNaren/pytorch/blob/rnn-volta/torch/backends/cudnn/__init__.py#L260-L263
Actually, I'm not sure lua torch cudnn RNN bindings support fp16, so that would be a more involved project. I think CudaTensors are hardcoded there in a few places. So first you would need to enable general fp16 support, and then enable tensor cores as shown above.
